attributes.additional_details:
With the exception of the million or so Pensioners who never or hardly worked whilst under 65yrs, DO NOT TAKE AWAY nor TAX those few Benefits eg. Winter Heating (WHA) & Bus Passes from them.
What is the moral reasoning that allows a non worker to claim upto £500 per week (INCOME) without any deduction, but Tax Pensioner's private/work pension & then remove those few benefits?
VOTE against touching Pensioners' WHA & Bus Passes
